intro: Rubus × falsivestitus, commonly known as the false blackberry. It is a hybrid shrub belonging to the Rosaceae family, characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits. The plant typically grows in woodland edges and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are alternate, with serrated margins, and the flowers are white to pale pink. The fruit, which resembles a blackberry, is edible but often has a tart flavor.
